description: Students study musculoskeletal anatomy (structure) and kinesiology (science of human motion) from
the perspective of dance training and performance.  Students learn anatomical terminology,
identify select bones (major features, articulations) and muscles (locations, actions), and
analyze their influence during coordinated movement patterns.  Students learn joint structure and
mechanics, alignment and imbalances, movement behavior, conditioning needs, and injury
prevention.  Students learn to notice, measure, experience, sense, and reflect upon the impact of
anatomical characteristics and anomalies.  Offered alternate years in the fall semester.
students taking this course should have previous experience in a movement intensive practice
